All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AlertSimulator
This class provides a simple alert simulation window to display error messages.
CheckoutConfirmation
 
CustomerClient
A standalone Customer Client that can be run independently without launching the full system.
CustomerController
 
CustomerModel
TODO You can either directly modify the CustomerModel class to implement the required tasks, or create a subclass of CustomerModel and override specific methods where appropriate.
CustomerView
The CustomerView is separated into two sections by a line : 1.
DatabaseRW
The DatabaseRW interface defines the contract for interacting with the product database.
DatabaseRWFactory
The DatabaseRWFactory class centralizes database configuration and object creation.
DerbyRW
ProductTable definition "CREATE TABLE ProductTable(" + "productID CHAR(4) PRIMARY KEY," + "description VARCHAR(100)," + "unitPrice DOUBLE," + "image VARCHAR(100)," + "inStock INT," + "CHECK (inStock >= 0)" + ")",
EmergencyExit
The class EmergencyExit used to immediately shut down the entire application.
HistoryWindow
This class provides a simple history window to display a list of events (successfully delete, edit and add a new product).
ImageFileManager
The ImageFileManager class handles the file operations related to product images in the warehouse system.
Launcher
The Launcher class serves as the main entry point of the system.
LoginClient
Creates and links a standalone login client - can be used for testing
LoginController
The controller component for the login feature - allows the view to execute functionality within the model
LoginModel
The model of the login feature - manages the logic of logging in, tracks logins, and tracks if the user has logged in yet
LoginType
An enum to track the different types of login, staff login or customer login
LoginView
The view component of the Login system, constructs the window to enable the user to type in their credentials and swap between a staff or customer login
Main
The Main JavaFX application class.
Order
The Order class represents a customer order, including metadata and a list of ordered products.
OrderCounter
OrderCounter is responsible for generating unique, sequential orderIDs for new orders.
OrderFileManager
This class manages creation, updating, and relocation of order files.
OrderHub
OrderHub serves as the heart of the ordering system.
OrderState
Represents the state of an order in the system.
OrderTracker
OrderTracker class is for tracking orders and their states.
OrderTrackerClient
A standalone OrderTracker client that can be run independently without launching the full system.
PickerClient
A standalone Order Picker Client that can be run independently without launching the full system.
PickerController
 
PickerModel
PickerModel represents the logic order picker.
PickerView
The Order Picker window is for staff to prepare customer's order.
Product
The Product class used to hold the information about a product: Fields: - productId: Unique identifier for the product (eg 0001).
ProductListFormatter
This class builds a formatted, receipt-like summary from a list of products.
RemoveProductNotifier
- The scene is created only once to avoid unnecessary recreation of the same layout.
SetDatabase
The setDB class is responsible for resetting the database when the system is first initialized.
SetOrderFileSystem
This class is responsible for seting up the folder structure and orderCounter file required for the order system.
StorageLocation
This class centralizes the location of all external storage folders and files used by the system.
UIStyle
UIStyle is a centralized Java final class that holds all JavaFX UI-related style and size constants used across all client views in the system.
WarehouseClient
A standalone Warehouse client that can be run independently without launching the full system.
WarehouseController
 
WarehouseModel
 
WarehouseView
The Warehouse interface (WarehouseView) contains two main pages: a divider line is between the two pages 1.
WindowBounds
The WindowBounds class represents the dimensions and position of a window.
WinPosManager
This final class is responsible for managing the dynamic positioning of windows on the screen.
